extendedInfo.description: As an international scientific society of more than 62,000 members representing over 144 countries, AGU is committed to advancing Earth and space science. AGU provides a collaborative forum for the geophysical community through scientific journals, books, a weekly news service, scientific and technical committee activities, and online data and information services.  Through AGU scientific meetings and conferences, communication outreach programs, and activities that connect scientists to policy makers, AGU gives members a platform to share their research with both scientific and non-scientific audiences to advance science for the benefit of humanity and to ensure a sustainable future.ABOUT MEETING OF THE AMERICAS: AGU Meeting of the Americas is a Joint Assembly that covers topics in all areas of the geophysical sciences. Join your colleagues, including Earth and space scientists, educators, students, and other leaders as they connect to present groundbreaking research.
